section.title: Overview
section.para: The module is an implementation of the internal DB API v1 connector for SQlite 3 file.

section.title: &kamailio; Modules

No dependencies on other &kamailio; modules.

section.title: External Libraries or Applications
section.para:
The following libraries or applications must be installed before running &kamailio; with this module loaded:
SQlite 3 library - e.g., libsqlite3-0
SQlite 3 devel library - to compile the module e.g. libsqlite3-dev
SQlite 3 utilities - for kamdbctl e.g. sqlite3

section.title: db_set_readonly (string)
section.para:
This will set the db connection to "SQLITE_OPEN_READONLY", useful if another program is writing to the DB. The value is the full path to the sqlite file used for example in any db_url or sqlops/sqlcon
This parameter may be set multiple times to set many DB connections to readonly in the same configuration file.

para.emphasis: By default all the db connections are using "SQLITE_OPEN_READWRITE | SQLITE_OPEN_CREATE"

example.title: Set db_set_readonly parameter
example.programlisting: ... modparam("db_sqlite","db_set_readonly","/var/mydb.sqlite") modparam("sqlops","sqlcon","lrn=>sqlite:////var/mydb.sqlite") # Example if using the sqlops module ...

section.title: db_set_journal_mode (string)
section.para:
This will set the db connection journal mode, for the given connection. The value is the full path to the sqlite file used for example in any db_url or sqlops/sqlcon
Other journal mode are : DELETE | TRUNCATE | PERSIST | MEMORY | WAL | OFF
This parameter may be set multiple times to set many DB connections to readonly in the same configuration file.

para.emphasis: By default all the db connections are using sqlite default journaling mode.

example.title: Set db_set_journal_mode parameter
example.programlisting:
... # In this example we are using Write-Ahead Logging in order to update the database from another process(external to Kamailio) without facing any locking.
#!subst "!DB_FILE!/var/mydb.sqlite!" modparam("db_sqlite","db_set_readonly","DB_FILE") # We are also opening the database in readonly modparam("db_sqlite","db_set_journal_mode","DB_FILE=WAL;") modparam("sqlops","sqlcon","lrn=>sqlite:///DB_FILE") ...
